title: Bleeding Control
steps: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth or bandage
Elevate the injured area above the heart if possible
Apply additional pressure if bleeding continues
Call emergency services if bleeding is severe or doesn't stop
Do not remove objects embedded in the wound
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention for severe bleeding
Do not use tourniquet unless trained

title: Minor Burns
steps: Cool the burn with cool running water for 10-15 minutes
Remove jewelry or tight clothing near the burn
Cover with a clean, dry cloth or sterile bandage
Do not apply ice, butter, or ointments
Take over-the-counter pain relievers if needed
warnings: Seek medical attention for burns larger than 3 inches
Do not break blisters

title: Choking (Adult)
steps: Ask 'Are you choking?' and look for signs of distress
Stand behind person, place hands above navel
Make quick upward thrusts until object is expelled
Call emergency services if person becomes unconscious
warnings: Only perform Heimlich if person is conscious
Seek immediate medical help

title: CPR (Adult)
steps: Place hands in center of chest
Push hard and fast (100-120 compressions per minute)
Give 2 rescue breaths after every 30 compressions
Continue until help arrives or person recovers
warnings: Only perform if trained in CPR
Call emergency services first

title: Sprains and Strains
steps: Apply ice for 15-20 minutes every 2-3 hours
warnings: Seek medical attention if pain is severe
Don't apply heat for first 48 hours

title: Nosebleed
steps: Sit upright and lean slightly forward
Apply ice pack to bridge of nose
Avoid blowing nose for several hours
warnings: Seek medical attention if bleeding lasts more than 20 minutes
Don't tilt head back

title: Heat Exhaustion
steps: Apply cool, wet cloths to skin
Drink cool water or sports drinks
Fan the person or use air conditioning
Monitor for signs of heat stroke
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention if symptoms worsen
Heat stroke is life-threatening

title: Hypothermia
steps: Give warm, non-alcoholic drinks if conscious
Use body heat from another person if needed
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't use hot water or heating pads

title: Allergic Reaction (Mild)
steps: Identify and remove allergen if possible
Apply cool compress to affected area
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention for severe reactions
Anaphylaxis is life-threatening

title: Seizure
steps: Stay calm and time the seizure
Place person on side to prevent choking
Call emergency services if seizure lasts more than 5 minutes
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention for prolonged seizures
Don't leave person alone

title: Fracture (Suspected)
steps: Don't move the person unless necessary
Don't try to straighten or realign bones
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't move person with suspected spinal injury

title: Eye Injury
steps: Rinse eye with clean water for 15 minutes
Don't remove objects embedded in eye
Cover both eyes with clean cloth
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't delay treatment for eye injuries

title: Poisoning (Swallowed)
steps: Save container or label of substance
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't give anything by mouth unless instructed

title: Shock
steps: Elevate legs 12 inches if no head injury
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Shock can be life-threatening

title: Stroke (Suspected)
steps: Stay with person until help arrives
warnings: Time is critical for stroke treatment
Seek immediate medical attention

title: Heart Attack (Suspected)
steps: Have person sit or lie down
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Time is critical for heart attack treatment

title: Drowning (Near)
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Even if person seems fine, get medical evaluation

title: Electric Shock
steps: Turn off power source if safe to do so
Don't touch person until power is off
warnings: Don't touch person while still connected to power
Seek immediate medical attention

title: Insect Sting (Severe Reaction)
steps: Wash area with soap and water
Monitor for signs of severe reaction
Call emergency services for severe reactions
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention for severe reactions
Anaphylaxis can be life-threatening

title: Snake Bite
steps: Position bitten area at or below heart level
Don't cut, suck, or apply tourniquet
Note time of bite and snake description
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't delay treatment for snake bites

title: Concussion (Suspected)
steps: Apply ice to head if no open wound
Don't return to activity until cleared by doctor
warnings: Seek medical attention for any head injury
Symptoms can worsen over time

title: Frostbite
steps: Warm with body heat or warm water
Don't use hot water or heating pads
warnings: Seek medical attention for frostbite
Don't thaw if risk of refreezing

title: Heat Stroke
steps: Cool with water, ice, or wet cloths
warnings: Heat stroke is life-threatening
Seek immediate medical attention

title: Diabetic Emergency (Low Blood Sugar)
steps: Give sugar if person is conscious
Use glucose tablets, juice, or candy
Stay with person until help arrives
warnings: Seek medical attention if person becomes unconscious
Don't give food if unconscious

title: Asthma Attack
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention for severe attacks
Don't delay treatment

title: Fainting
steps: Catch person if possible to prevent injury
Call emergency services if unconscious for more than 1 minute
warnings: Seek medical attention if person doesn't regain consciousness
Check for injuries from fall

title: Cuts and Scrapes
steps: Clean wound with soap and water
warnings: Seek medical attention for deep cuts
Watch for signs of infection

title: Splinter Removal
steps: Pull out in same direction it entered
Clean area with soap and water
warnings: Seek medical attention if splinter is deep or infected
Don't dig with sharp objects

title: Blisters
steps: Clean area with soap and water
warnings: Seek medical attention if blister becomes infected
Don't remove skin over blister

title: Sunburn
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe sunburn
Watch for signs of heat illness

title: Bruises
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe bruises
Watch for signs of internal bleeding

title: Muscle Cramps
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe or frequent cramps
Stay hydrated

title: Back Pain (Acute)
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe pain
Watch for signs of nerve damage

title: Neck Pain
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe pain
Don't ignore neck pain after injury

title: Headache
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe or sudden headaches
Watch for signs of serious condition

title: Toothache
steps: Rinse mouth with warm salt water
Apply ice pack to outside of cheek
Avoid hot, cold, or sweet foods
Use dental floss to remove food particles
See dentist as soon as possible
warnings: Seek dental care for persistent toothache
Don't ignore dental pain

title: Earache
steps: Chew gum to help equalize pressure
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe ear pain
Don't ignore ear pain in children

title: Sore Throat
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe sore throat
Watch for signs of strep throat

title: Cough
warnings: Seek medical attention for persistent cough
Watch for signs of serious illness

title: Fever
steps: Seek medical attention if fever is high or persistent
warnings: Seek medical attention for high fever
Watch for signs of serious illness

title: Nausea and Vomiting
steps: Seek medical attention if vomiting persists
warnings: Seek medical attention for persistent vomiting
Watch for signs of dehydration

title: Diarrhea
steps: Eat bland foods like rice and bananas
Seek medical attention if severe or persistent
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe diarrhea
Watch for signs of dehydration

title: Constipation
steps: Don't ignore the urge to go
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe constipation
Don't overuse laxatives

title: Indigestion
warnings: Seek medical attention for severe indigestion
Watch for signs of serious condition

title: Insomnia
steps: Avoid caffeine and alcohol before bed
Exercise regularly but not before bed
warnings: Seek medical attention for persistent insomnia
Don't ignore sleep problems

title: Anxiety Attack
warnings: Seek professional help for severe anxiety
Don't ignore mental health concerns

title: Depression (Crisis)
warnings: Seek immediate professional help
Don't ignore suicidal thoughts

title: Panic Attack
warnings: Seek professional help for frequent panic attacks
Don't minimize the experience

title: Substance Overdose
warnings: Seek immediate medical attention
Don't delay treatment for overdoses

title: Self-Harm
warnings: Seek immediate professional help
Don't ignore self-harm behaviors
